preamble: This section contains information on the study, such as title, links to publications and datasets, etc. NOTE: If you notice a bug, or have a suggestion, we'd be grateful if you posted an issue on GitHub: https://github.com/INCF/artem-is/
question: At the time of document creation, what is the current ARTEM-IS template for?
choices: Documenting a planned pipeline | Documenting a pipeline that has been applied to study data

question: Current title of the study/pipeline
Is the current title the same as it appears or as it will appear in related publications?
choices: no | yes | final decision not made yet

question: Has the current study or pipeline been known by a different (published or working) title?
Alternative title(s) of this study
Change_log: 25.08.2023 I reworded this to include any titles, not just working, because that is what the question above is asking

question: Authors of the study in the following format: family-name, other names. Each author separated by a semicolon and a space.
Has the study resulted in any published articles, conference presentations or research reports at this stage?
Do any of these publications have a DOI?
DOIs of related publications, separated by a semicolon and a space.
Are there any web-accessible publications that do not have a DOI?
Provide links to non-DOI publications, separated by a semicolon and a space.
Has this study resulted in any datasets archived in a persistent, version controlled repository, administered independently from the authorship team?
What types of data are available?
choices: raw EEG data | individual epochs | averaged ERPs for individual participants | grand average ERPs for all conditions, amplitude measures | component amplitudes/latencies and other measures for statistical analysis | other

question: Types of data not included in list
Do any of these datasets have a DOI?
Dataset DOIs separated by a semicolon and a space.
Are there any datasets that do not have a DOI?
Provide reference for the datasets that do not have DOI.
Change_log: 7.9.2023 Angela: change the question text - text of a different question was dupplicated here by mistake

question: Has this study resulted in any supplementary materials other than data and publications?
details: For example, code, visualization plots, tables, lists of stimuly, etc.

question: Which supplementary materials are available publically?
choices: list of stimulus descriptions (e.g. list of objects shown in images) | stimuli files | experimental task files/code | other

question: Which other supplementary materials are available?
Provide the link to the location of supplementary materials on the web.
Are any elements in the study currently covered by a license allowing for reuse?
details: For example, code used to run the study, data arising from the study

question: Which elements are covered by a license?
Change_log: 7.9.2023 Angela: removed "elements" from "other elements" in case it will create a problem for automatic changes to "other" options in all questions

question: License type for code.
choices: Public Domain | Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and License | Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Universal | Multiple | Other

question: Licence types for each code element, with name of element followed by license type, separated by semicolon and a space
License type for code (other than listed)
License type for data.
choices: Public Domain | Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and License | Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Universal | Multiple | Other

question: Licence types for each data element, with name of element followed by license type, separated by semicolon and a space
License type for data (other than listed)
Name of each licensed study element followed by license type, with listed elements separated by semicolon and a space.
details: For example, derivatives, figures, slides, etc.

question: Study abstract
Keywords, separated by semicolons followed by space
Does the project have (or did it have) financial support from a funding agency?
If this project is (was) being funded, please list grant numbers and funding agencies, separated by a semicolon and a space.
At the time of writing has the study been approved by an ethics committee?
If the study has been aproved by an ethics comittee, list the approval ID and institution which granted it. If there are multiple approvals, separate them by semicolons followed by space.
Do you have any acknowledgments to add in addition to authors or funding?
Acknowledgements
Do you have any instructions on how you (or the authors) want this study to be cited or otherwise acknowledged?
Citation instructions
